result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrick Dean Cleveland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management and Domestic Abuse.  AODA per agent.  Absolute Sobriety.  DE has 1 day credit if probation revoked.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Cover Letter from DOC to Br. 1

Defendant Garrick Dean Cleveland in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:  Dismissed but read in 

Counts 2 & 3:
24 months Probation
DNA sample
Undergo any counseling per agent to include Anger Management & Domestic Abuse
Seek/obtain full time employment
AODA & treatment
Absolute Sobriety
1 day credit if probation revoked
$453.00 x $443.00 Costs  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Garrick Dean Cleveland in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim, M.T. appears in person.  Request no contact be lifted.  State responds and is opposed.  Attorney ORourke request motion be granted and amended to give a no violent or abusive contact w/ victim.  Reviews criminal history w/ court.  Court denies bond modification.  No contact continues.

Pre-trial conference on April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return date on April 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Garrick Dean Cleveland appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Peter Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. State requests $250 Cash bond.   DE does qualify for PD representation. Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1000.00 Signature  bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/MBT(9/24/94); May get belongings one time w/law enforcement  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
